input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL FOREST HOLDING, STATE FORESTS, KOSZĘCIN FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: Providing Forest Management Services in the Koszęcin Forest District in 2026. Description: The subject of the order are forest management services as defined in Art. 6 section 1 point 1 of the Act of 28 September 1991 on forests (consolidated text: Journal of Laws of 2025, item 567 - "Forest Act"), covering work in the field of breeding, seed production and forest protection, nature conservation, fire protection, including PAD operation, maintenance of forest facilities, timber harvesting and skidding, and work related to the operation of the Game Breeding Center, maintenance of nesting boxes, meadow and agricultural management, specialized soil preparation for the next year, shredding of residues post-logging, spraying against weeds - to be performed in the Koszęcin Forest District in 2026. The scope of the subject of the order includes the total amount of works in the field of breeding, seed production and forest protection, nature protection, fire protection, maintenance of forest facilities, harvesting and skidding of wood, as well as work related to the operation of the Game Breeding Center, maintenance of nesting boxes, meadow and agricultural management, specialized soil preparation for the next year, grinding of logging residues, spraying against weeds - to be performed in the Forest District Koszęcin in 2026 resulting from Annex No. 2 to the SWZ. The estimated value of the order includes the basic order, the option right worth 30% of the basic order and the orders referred to in Art. 214 section 1 point 7 of the Public Procurement Law with a value of 50% of the basic order.<br> Package I forestry: K.... Tender Value: 165690.92. Currency: PLN. Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-11-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: 1. The subject of the order is financed by the European Funds for Podlaskie Program 2021-2027, Priority FEPK.01 Competitive and Digital Economy, Measure FEPK.01.02 Digitization.<br> 2. The order includes the delivery and implementation of a stationary water meter reading system based on radio transmission, along with the delivery of the necessary software, granting a software license, system launch and integration with the ZSI billing module. The provided system is intended to standardize and improve the process of reading water meters and introduce the process of calculating fees for consumed water. and discharged sewage on a monthly basis for all recipients. The implementation of the system will reduce the need to enter the recipient's property each time to read the water meter level, which will reduce errors caused by the human factor. The stationary water meter reading system will allow to generate water consumption charts and detect leaks at customers.<br> 3. Scope of the order:<br> 1) delivery of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 2) installation of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 3) license for a stationary water meter reading system.<br> 4. The order includes the delivery and implementation of a stationary water meter reading system based on radio transmission, along with the delivery of the necessary software, granting a software license, system launch and integration with the ZSI billing module. The provided system is intended to standardize and improve the process of reading water meters and introduce the process of calculating fees for consumed water. and discharged sewage on a monthly basis for all recipients. The implementation of the system will reduce the need to enter the recipient's property each time to read the water meter level, which will reduce errors caused by the human factor. The stationary water meter reading system will allow to generate water consumption charts and detect leaks at customers.<br> 3. Scope of the order:<br> 1) delivery of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 2) installation of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 3) license for a stationary water meter reading system.<br> 4. The subject of the order is the supply of devices and equipment for the task: Strengthening the Civil Protection System in the Jaktorow Commune. The task is co-financed from the state budget from the Civil Protection and Civil Defense Program for 2025-2026.2. As part of the subject of the order, the Contractor will provide the required devices and equipment and unload them and bring them to the place indicated by the Ordering Party (at the Ordering Party's registered office or in another place in the Jaktorow commune indicated by the Ordering Party). Products must be brand new, in accordance with the requirements specified in the OPZ, and free from any physical defects and legal. A manufacturer's warranty is required for the delivered products. Together with the deliveries, the Contractor will provide the Ordering Party with catalog cards, approvals and certificates (if required), warranty cards and operating manuals. All documents must be in Polish. 3. The subject of the order has been divided into 3 parts in accordance with Appendix No. 3 to the SWZ Description of the subject of the order/Appendix No. 1 to the Offer Form. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PRZEDSIĘBIORSTWO MUNICIPAL SPOŁKA Z OGRANICZONĄ ODPOWIEDZIALNOŚCIĄ. Summary: "Digitization of the Process of Reading, Recording and Settling Water Consumption and Establishing an Electronic Service Office for Siemiatycze Residents in the Field of Water and Sewage Management" Part I. Description: 1. The subject of the order is financed by the European Funds for Podlaskie Program 2021-2027, Priority FEPK.01 Competitive and Digital Economy, Measure FEPK.01.02 Digitization.<br> 2. The order includes the delivery and implementation of a stationary water meter reading system based on radio transmission, along with the delivery of the necessary software, granting a software license, system launch and integration with the ZSI billing module. The provided system is intended to standardize and improve the process of reading water meters and introduce the process of calculating fees for consumed water. and discharged sewage on a monthly basis for all recipients. The implementation of the system will reduce the need to enter the recipient's property each time to read the water meter level, which will reduce errors caused by the human factor. The stationary water meter reading system will allow to generate water consumption charts and detect leaks at customers.<br> 3. Scope of the order:<br> 1) delivery of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 2) installation of 2,946 radio overlays for water meters along with the necessary infrastructure for data transmission;<br> 3) license for a stationary water meter reading system.<br> 4. A detailed description of the subject of the order along with the minimum requirements is presented in Annex No. 2 to the SWZ - Detailed Description of the Subject of the Order (SOPZ).<br> "Digitization of the process of reading, recording and settling consumption water<br> about.... output.Description: Expansion of the ITS System to improve urban mobility and promote pedestrian and bicycle traffic, along with the implementation of a system for measuring the occupancy of parking spaces and places dedicated to...<br> Expansion of the ITS System to improve urban mobility and promote pedestrian traffic i cycling along with the implementation of a system for measuring the occupancy of parking spaces and spaces dedicated to disabled people in the paid parking zone as part of the project: "Development of sustainable urban transport in Białystok and the urban functional area".<br> The subject of the order is: expansion of the existing ITS System in order to improve urban mobility and promote pedestrian and bicycle traffic, along with the implementation of a system for measuring the occupancy of parking spaces and spaces dedicated to disabled people in the paid parking zone, which includes:<br> 1) system adjustment priorities for public transport buses to the new SIP protocol,<br> 2) introducing automatic detection of pedestrians and cyclists at intersections, crossings and crossings with signals, together with the introduction of solutions for automatic counting and distinguishing road users, and average speed measurements,<br> 3) introduction of mobile applications that make it easier for cyclists to move around the city by automatically reporting the need for a green signal,<br> 4) use of bicycle totems with information for users about movement and environmental parameters,<br> 5) introduction priorities for emergency vehicles by adapting signaling algorithms and equipping emergency vehicles with the necessary devices,<br> 6) launching the occupancy measurement system places...

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPAL ROADS AUTHORITY IN GLIWICE. Summary: Expansion and Modernization of the its System in Gliwice. Description: The subject of the order is the expansion and modernization of the Intelligent Transport System (hereinafter referred to as: "ITS") in Gliwice as part of the project entitled: "Development of sustainable mobility of urban transport in Gliwice" in order to increase the accessibility, comfort and safety of road users and supporting low-emission urban transport.<br> The order is carried out in the "design and build" formula and includes two main stages:<br> Stage 1 (Design) - development of comprehensive design documentation for the ITS system, including concepts for the modernization and expansion of subsystems, projects traffic organization (permanent and temporary), as well as obtaining the required opinions, arrangements and permits necessary to carry out the works.<br> Order also includes ensuring the integration of all subsystems, operational support, warranty service and training of the Ordering Party's staff in the operation and use of the extensive system.<br> A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex 8 to this Specification Terms of Order (SWZ) and in the Functional and Utility Program (FFU) - Annex No. 17 to the SWZ.<br> The task entitled: "Expansion and modernization of the ITS system in Gliwice" implemented as part of the project entitled: "Development of sustainable mobility of urban transport in Gliwice" implemented under the program Find.... No. 3a, 3b, 3c and Annex No. 4a (Description of forestry work technology) and Annex 4b (Sortment system of timber harvesting in forestry) to the SWZ. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services. Description: The surveillance of the EU-s land and sea borders is a fundamental component of the European integrated Border Management (EIBM) as identified by the Multiannual Strategic Policy for EIBM 2023-2027 . Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT.... Tender Value: 3000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-16. Closing Date: 2025-11-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT...

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services. Description: The surveillance of the EU-s land and sea borders is a fundamental component of the European integrated Border Management (EIBM) as identified by the Multiannual Strategic Policy for EIBM 2023-2027 . Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT.... Tender Value: 3000000. Currency: EUR. Published Date: 2025-10-13. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX)
output.Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services

The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT...
